page.title: 19Pencombe Hall.
page.content: Pencombe Hall was built in 1862,by Mr. R.Arkwright.There was a farmhouse on the site,that was pulled down. Pencombe Hall is now a rest home for elderly people.It has 16 people living in;13 staff and one part time gardener.It is set in beautiful surroundings,with a view of the Malvern Hills. Residents,that are able,can walk around the grounds.Those who are not so mobile can be taken outside in wheel chairs by the staff. They have breakfast in their own bedrooms and the other meals of the day are taken in the spacious dining- room.Television can be watched in the lounge,in comfortable arm chairs. There is a lift to take residents and their visitors to all floors.
